children.name: At NOVACRM, we prioritise the security and confidentiality of your personal information. As a leading provider of innovative real estate technology solutions, including our cutting-edge CRM platform and comprehensive website services, we understand the critical importance of protecting your data. This Privacy Policy outlines our approach to collecting, using, and safeguarding your personal information when you interact with our digital platforms and services.
Your Role in Ensuring Online Security
Your Role in Ensuring Online Security

To protect your privacy and secure your account, we strongly recommend logging out of your account after each session, especially if you are using a shared or public computer. This simple step helps prevent unauthorised access to your account and personal data. Additionally, it is important to keep your login credentials private. Sharing your username and password can compromise the security of both your personal and professional information.

We advise you to install and regularly update reliable antivirus software on your devices. Keeping your software up to date is a proactive measure to protect against malware, viruses, and other cyber threats that could potentially endanger your data security when interacting with our services.
1. Restricted Usage: We do not use Google Workspace APIs to develop, improve, or train generalized artificial intelligence (AI) or machine learning (ML) models.
: We do not use Google Workspace APIs to develop, improve, or train generalized artificial intelligence (AI) or machine learning (ML) models.

2. Data Handling: Any data accessed through Google Workspace APIs is used solely for the purpose of providing and improving the specific features and services outlined in our platform. No data is shared, used, or repurposed beyond these stated purposes.

: Any data accessed through Google Workspace APIs is used solely for the purpose of providing and improving the specific features and services outlined in our platform. No data is shared, used, or repurposed beyond these stated purposes.

3. Compliance with Google’s Data Policies: We adhere strictly to Google’s API Terms of Service and ensure that all interactions with Google Workspace APIs comply with their guidelines and requirements.
: We adhere strictly to Google’s API Terms of Service and ensure that all interactions with Google Workspace APIs comply with their guidelines and requirements.
4. No Data Sharing: Data accessed via Google Workspace APIs is not shared with third parties or used for training external AI/ML models.
: Data accessed via Google Workspace APIs is not shared with third parties or used for training external AI/ML models.
5. Data Privacy and Security: All data processed via Google Workspace APIs is handled securely and in accordance with applicable data privacy laws and regulations.
: All data processed via Google Workspace APIs is handled securely and in accordance with applicable data privacy laws and regulations.

Personal information refers to any data that can be used to identify you, either directly or indirectly. This includes obvious identifiers like your name and email address, but also encompasses less visible data such as IP addresses, device details, and behavioural patterns observed on our platform.
2. Types of Personal Data We Collect
2. Types of Personal Data We Collect
At NOVACRM, the types of personal information we may collect include:
• Basic Identifiers: Such as your name, residential address, and date of birth.
Such as your name, residential address, and date of birth.
• Contact Information: Including email addresses and phone numbers
Including email addresses and phone numbers
• Professional Information: Job titles, company names, and related details
Job titles, company names, and related details
• Account Credentials: Usernames, passwords, and other login information.
Usernames, passwords, and other login information.
• Financial Information: Payment details required for using our services.
Payment details required for using our services.
• Technical Data: IP addresses, types of web browsers, and other device-related information.
IP addresses, types of web browsers, and other device-related information.
• Usage Data: Patterns of how you interact with our platform, including pages visited and features used.
Patterns of how you interact with our platform, including pages visited and features used.
Our privacy policy is crafted to ensure protection for everyone who interacts with NOVACRM. Here’s a detailed breakdown of who benefits from our privacy measures:

• Website Visitors and Mobile App Users: This includes anyone who browses our websites or uses our mobile applications. Regardless of whether you’re just visiting or actively engaging with our platforms, your privacy is safeguarded.
Website Visitors and Mobile App Users:
This includes anyone who browses our websites or uses our mobile applications. Regardless of whether you’re just visiting or actively engaging with our platforms, your privacy is safeguarded.

• Current and Prospective Clients: We cover both existing clients who use our services and potential clients who are exploring what we offer. Whether you are already a customer or considering becoming one, we are committed to protecting your personal information.

We cover both existing clients who use our services and potential clients who are exploring what we offer. Whether you are already a customer or considering becoming one, we are committed to protecting your personal information.

• Business Partners and Service Providers: This extends to organisations and individuals who work with us in a professional capacity. Our privacy policy ensures that any data shared with our partners and service providers is handled with the same level of care and confidentiality.

This extends to organisations and individuals who work with us in a professional capacity. Our privacy policy ensures that any data shared with our partners and service providers is handled with the same level of care and confidentiality.

• Job Applicants and Employees: If you are applying for a job with us or are currently employed at NOVACRM, your personal data is protected under our policy. We ensure that any information related to your application or employment is securely managed.

If you are applying for a job with us or are currently employed at NOVACRM, your personal data is protected under our policy. We ensure that any information related to your application or employment is securely managed.

• Other Third Parties: This includes any additional individuals or entities who interact with our services in any way. Whether you are a vendor, consultant, or have another type of engagement with NOVACRM, your privacy is respected and upheld.

This includes any additional individuals or entities who interact with our services in any way. Whether you are a vendor, consultant, or have another type of engagement with NOVACRM, your privacy is respected and upheld.

We utilise advanced, privacy-conscious technologies to automatically gather certain non-personal data. This includes technical information such as IP addresses, types of web browsers, and usage patterns on our site. This data is vital for improving our services, enhancing user experience, and maintaining the security of our platform.

When you sign up for our services or contact us, we collect the information you provide during the registration or communication process. This includes personal details like your name, email address, and other necessary information.

In the course of receiving customer support, we gather details from your interactions with our support team. This includes the specifics of your requests and any related communication to help us address your needs effectively.

To improve our services, we may solicit your input through various channels such as feedback forms or opinion surveys. The information collected includes your responses and suggestions on how we can enhance our offerings.
We track the settings and preferences you establish within your account. This helps us customise our services to better align with your individual preferences and needs.
We may also use information that is publicly available and relevant to our services. This helps us improve and tailor our services based on widely accessible data.
The data we collect is utilised to:
• Personalise Your Experience: Tailoring your interactions with our platform to better suit your preferences.
Tailoring your interactions with our platform to better suit your preferences.
• Enhance Services: Improving our CRM and website services based on user feedback and behavioural insights.
Improving our CRM and website services based on user feedback and behavioural insights.
• Respond to Inquiries: Efficiently handling customer support requests and inquiries.
Efficiently handling customer support requests and inquiries.
• Conduct Market Research: Analysing trends and staying ahead in the industry.
Analysing trends and staying ahead in the industry.
• Ensure Compliance: Meeting legal and regulatory requirements.
Our aim is to handle your data with the utmost responsibility, ensuring that you receive the best possible service while adhering to high privacy and security standards.

We implement state-of-the-art security measures to protect your personal data. These measures include encryption, firewalls, and regular security audits to prevent unauthorised access, alteration, or disclosure of your information.

We retain your personal information only for the period necessary to fulfil our service obligations or comply with legal requirements. Once the data is no longer needed for these purposes, we securely dispose of it to ensure your privacy.

We believe in empowering you with control over your data. You have the right to access, correct, or request the deletion of your personal information. Our dedicated support team is available to assist with any data-related requests or concerns you may have.

We use cookies and similar technologies to enhance your browsing experience, remember your preferences, and analyse usage patterns. These technologies help us continually improve our platform and tailor it to your needs.
• Session Cookies: Temporary cookies that maintain your session while you navigate our site.
Temporary cookies that maintain your session while you navigate our site.
• Persistent Cookies: Cookies that store your preferences for future visits.
Cookies that store your preferences for future visits.
• Analytics Cookies: Cookies that provide insights into how users interact with our site.
Cookies that provide insights into how users interact with our site.
You have full control over cookie settings through your browser. While changing these settings may impact certain site functionalities, we respect your choices regarding online privacy.

Invisible markers, often referred to as web beacons, pixel tags, or clear GIFs, are tiny, transparent images embedded in web pages or emails. These markers gather non-personal data, such as interaction details and general usage patterns. Their primary role is to assist us in analysing the effectiveness of our marketing strategies and understanding broader usage trends.

We incorporate invisible markers in our email communications to gauge how recipients engage with our messages. By tracking metrics like open rates and click-through rates, we can better tailor our content and improve the relevance and impact of our communications.
3. Personal Data Preferences: Your Control Options
3. Personal Data Preferences: Your Control Options

You have the power to decide how we handle your Personal Information by choosing to “opt in” or “opt out” of certain uses. For example, you can decide if you want to receive our email updates and promotional content. We ensure your Personal Information remains confidential and will not be shared with third parties without your consent. If you wish to stop receiving marketing emails, click the opt out or “unsubscribe” link provided in those emails. You can also adjust your communication preferences via our Data Subject Access Request (DSAR) Portal at
. Should you encounter issues with the portal, you can contact us at

for support. Keep in mind that opting out of marketing messages does not affect our ability to contact you regarding important aspects of your account, transactions, or necessary updates. We may still reach out with essential information related to your engagement with our services or as required by law.

At NOVACRM, we leverage your Personal Information to deliver and enhance our range of products and services. Our use of your data spans several key areas, including fulfilling your requests, personalising your experience, and ensuring compliance with legal requirements. We integrate both personal and non-personal data collected from various sources, including third-party providers, to achieve these goals.

We utilise your information to efficiently process and fulfil your requests for products and services. This may involve sharing necessary details with third parties to ensure your requests are completed accurately and promptly.

By examining your interactions and behaviours, we gain insights that help us refine our marketing strategies and optimise the distribution of our products and services. This analysis enables us to better understand and cater to your preferences.

Your Personal Information allows us to tailor our services, websites, mobile applications, and advertisements to align with your interests and needs. This personalization ensures that you receive relevant content and offers that match your preferences.

We use your data to safeguard the security and functionality of our platforms. This includes protecting our websites and services from potential threats and maintaining the integrity of our operations.
We process your information to comply with applicable legal and regulatory obligations. This ensures that our practices align with relevant laws and standards.
Your feedback, including reviews and comments, is used to address your concerns and make necessary improvements to our services. We value your input as it helps us enhance our offerings.

If you apply for a position with us, you may provide details such as your resume and educational background. We use this information for recruitment and employment purposes within NOVACRM and its affiliated entities.

With your consent, we may send you promotional content about products and services that could interest you. We also engage in ad networks that serve personalised ads based on your online activities. You can opt out of these communications by following the unsubscribe instructions provided in our emails. If you provide your phone number, you consent to receiving telemarketing calls and automated messages. You can opt out of these communications at any time. By providing your phone number, you also release us from any liability related to these communications. Note that providing your phone number is not a prerequisite for receiving our services.

To deliver and enhance our services, NOVACRM collaborates with various third-party providers. These partners assist us in areas such as website maintenance, product delivery, and customer support. For example, we may share your data with entities that handle web hosting, email communication, credit card processing, and data analytics on our behalf. These providers are bound by agreements to protect your information and only use it as necessary to fulfil their duties.

We may be legally obligated to disclose your information under certain circumstances. This could include complying with legal investigations, responding to court orders, addressing unlawful activities, or safeguarding public safety. Disclosures might also occur if required to adhere to company policies or legal mandates.

You have the right to access, update, or request the deletion of your personal information. To exercise these rights, you can contact us directly or submit a request through our Data Subject Access Request (DSAR) Portal on
. If the DSAR Portal is unavailable, you may reach out to us via email at
While we do not sell or rent your personal information, there are specific scenarios where data sharing is necessary:

We may share information with third-party vendors who assist in delivering services or products. Contracts with these vendors ensure that data is used solely for its intended purpose and protected according to applicable laws.

In the event of a business transaction such as a merger or acquisition, we may transfer your data to the new entity, provided that strict confidentiality agreements are in place. If a transaction does not proceed, the data will be returned or destroyed.

We might disclose information to comply with legal processes or to protect individuals safety. This includes responding to law enforcement requests, handling emergencies, or complying with legal requirements. Disclosure without consent may occur in certain cases where it is necessary to prevent harm or fraud.

Our website may contain links to external websites and services. We are not responsible for the privacy practices of these third parties. It’s important to review the privacy policies of any third-party sites you visit.

Should NOVACRM undergo a change in ownership through merger, acquisition, or other means, your information will be transferred to the new entity. We will notify you via email or a prominent notice on our website regarding any changes in ownership and how it affects your personal data.
You have the right to request corrections to any inaccurate personal information we hold about you. We will make reasonable efforts to update or amend your data as directed.

We implement a variety of security measures to protect your personal data, including administrative, technical, and physical safeguards. This involves using encryption technology, restricting access to authorised personnel, and conducting regular security reviews. However, while we strive to protect your data, no system can guarantee absolute security.

We retain personal information only for as long as necessary for its intended purpose or to comply with legal requirements. Data may be kept as long as your account is active, for business purposes, or to meet legal obligations. Upon withdrawal of consent, processing of your data will cease immediately.

To support our global operations, personal information may be transferred to different countries. We ensure that data transferred internationally is protected to the standards required by applicable laws, such as the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). We use standard contractual clauses or obtain consent where necessary for such transfers.
Managing Data Requests and Security Breaches
Managing Data Requests and Security Breaches

At NOVACRM, we prioritise your rights regarding personal data. If you request access to, correction of, or deletion of your personal information, we will endeavour to address your request within 30 days from receipt. This time frame allows us to review and act on your request comprehensively. Should we need additional time to process your request—due to its complexity or volume—we will promptly inform you of the delay, providing the reasons for the extended timeframe. In such cases, a reasonable fee may be applied to cover administrative costs associated with the request.

In instances where we experience a data security breach, we will act swiftly to notify all affected individuals as well as relevant regulatory authorities. Our primary goal is to mitigate any potential harm resulting from the breach. We will provide you with detailed information about the breach, including the nature of the incident, the data involved, and the steps we are taking to address and rectify the situation.
3. Compliance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)
3. Compliance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)

For our users in the US and Canada, NOVACRM fully complies with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). This regulation mandates that we uphold stringent standards for the protection and handling of personal data. To address any concerns or complaints regarding our data practices.
If you are unable to access the DSAR Portal, please send your requests to: Email:
For any unresolved issues or additional inquiries, you are welcome to contact us through the provided email or address.

At NOVACRM, we engage various third-party vendors and partners to support and enhance our services. These third-party entities may assist with customer service, data storage, or technical operations. We have formal agreements in place with these partners to ensure they adhere to strict privacy and security protocols, aligned with our Privacy Policy and relevant regulations. These partners may have access to, process, or store personal data as part of their service delivery but are restricted from using this data beyond the scope necessary to fulfill their roles. By interacting with our services, you consent to the sharing of your personal information with these third-party providers.
Handling of Personal Information Under PIPEDA ( Residents of Ontario, Canada)
Handling of Personal Information Under PIPEDA ( Residents of Ontario, Canada)

At NOVACRM, we are committed to protecting the privacy and security of your personal information in compliance with the Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act (PIPEDA). This policy outlines how we handle personal information collected in the course of providing our services.
We may collect personal information from you when you:
• Visit our website or interact with our online resources
Visit our website or interact with our online resources
The types of personal information we may collect include, but are not limited to:
• Contact details (name, email address, phone number, mailing address)
Contact details (name, email address, phone number, mailing address)
• Business information (company name, job title, industry)
Business information (company name, job title, industry)
• Usage data (IP address, browser type, operating system, interactions with our platform)
Usage data (IP address, browser type, operating system, interactions with our platform)
The personal information we collect is used for the following purposes:
• To provide, operate, and improve our services
To provide, operate, and improve our services
• To process transactions and manage billing
To process transactions and manage billing
• To communicate with you about your account, services, and updates
To communicate with you about your account, services, and updates
• To respond to your inquiries and provide customer support
To respond to your inquiries and provide customer support
• To personalise your experience with our platform
To personalise your experience with our platform
• To conduct research and analyse usage trends
To conduct research and analyse usage trends
• To ensure compliance with legal obligations and our Terms of Service
To ensure compliance with legal obligations and our Terms of Service

• Explicit Consent: We will obtain explicit consent from you when collecting, using, or disclosing your personal information for specific purposes, such as when you sign up for our services or participate in a promotion.

We will obtain explicit consent from you when collecting, using, or disclosing your personal information for specific purposes, such as when you sign up for our services or participate in a promotion.
• Implied Consent: In certain situations, we may infer your consent from your actions, such as when you provide contact information to request a service or product.
In certain situations, we may infer your consent from your actions, such as when you provide contact information to request a service or product.

You have the right to withdraw your consent at any time. If you choose to withdraw your consent, we will stop processing your personal information for the purposes for which consent was provided. However, this does not affect the legality of any processing carried out prior to your withdrawal. Please note that withdrawing consent may affect your ability to use certain services.
In certain exceptional circumstances, we may process your personal information without obtaining explicit consent, such as:
• When Consent is Impractical: If obtaining consent is not feasible in a timely manner and processing is necessary for the individual’s benefit, such as in an emergency situation.
If obtaining consent is not feasible in a timely manner and processing is necessary for the individual’s benefit, such as in an emergency situation.
• Fraud Detection and Prevention: We may process your information to detect, prevent, or investigate fraudulent activities to ensure the security of our services.
We may process your information to detect, prevent, or investigate fraudulent activities to ensure the security of our services.
• Business Transactions: : In the event of a business transaction, such as a merger or acquisition, we may process your data under specific conditions necessary to complete the transaction.
: In the event of a business transaction, such as a merger or acquisition, we may process your data under specific conditions necessary to complete the transaction.
• Legal Obligations: We may process personal information without consent if required by law or if we have reasonable grounds to believe it is necessary to comply with legal obligations.
We may process personal information without consent if required by law or if we have reasonable grounds to believe it is necessary to comply with legal obligations.
We do not sell, rent, or trade your personal information. We may share your personal information with third parties only under the following circumstances:
• With service providers who assist us in operating our business, subject to confidentiality agreements
With service providers who assist us in operating our business, subject to confidentiality agreements
• In the event of a business transaction, where personal information may be transferred as part of the transaction
In the event of a business transaction, where personal information may be transferred as part of the transaction
• As required by law, such as in response to a subpoena or legal process
As required by law, such as in response to a subpoena or legal process
• To protect our rights, property, or safety, or the rights, property, or safety of others
To protect our rights, property, or safety, or the rights, property, or safety of others

We take appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect your personal information against unauthorized access, loss, or misuse. These measures include encryption, secure servers, access controls, and regular security assessments.

We will retain your personal information only as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes for which it was collected, or as required by law. When your personal information is no longer needed, we will securely delete or anonymize it.
Under PIPEDA, you have the right to:
• Access your personal information held by us
Access your personal information held by us
• Correct any inaccuracies in your personal information
Correct any inaccuracies in your personal information
• Withdraw your consent for certain types of processing
Withdraw your consent for certain types of processing
• Request the deletion of your personal information, subject to legal obligations
Request the deletion of your personal information, subject to legal obligations
To exercise these rights, please contact us at

We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time to reflect changes in our practices or legal obligations. We will notify you of any significant changes and provide you with the opportunity to review the updated policy.
If you have any questions or concerns about how we handle your personal information, or if you wish to exercise your rights under PIPEDA, please contact us at

At NOVACRM, we are committed to safeguarding your privacy and personal data. This Data Protection Policy outlines how we collect, use, disclose, and protect your personal information in compliance with applicable data protection laws, including the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) for our EU users.
We may collect various types of personal data, including:
• Contact Information: Name, email address, phone number, and mailing address.
Name, email address, phone number, and mailing address.
• Account Details: Username, password, and any related account information.
Username, password, and any related account information.
• Payment Information: Credit card details and other payment information.
Credit card details and other payment information.
• Usage Data: Information about your interactions with our platform, such as IP addresses, browser types, and activity logs.
Information about your interactions with our platform, such as IP addresses, browser types, and activity logs.
• Communication Records: Data you provide when communicating with our support team or through feedback forms.
Data you provide when communicating with our support team or through feedback forms.
3. Legal Basis for Processing Your Data
3. Legal Basis for Processing Your Data
We process your personal data based on the following legal grounds:
• Consent: When you have provided explicit consent for specific purposes.
When you have provided explicit consent for specific purposes.
• Contractual Obligations: Where processing is necessary for the performance of a contract.
Where processing is necessary for the performance of a contract.
• Legal Compliance: To fulfill legal obligations.
• Legitimate Interests: When processing is based on our legitimate interests, provided they do not override your rights and freedoms.
When processing is based on our legitimate interests, provided they do not override your rights and freedoms.
Your personal data may be used for the following purposes:
• Service Delivery: To provide, maintain, and improve our services.
To provide, maintain, and improve our services.
• Billing and Payments: To process payments and manage billing.
To process payments and manage billing.
• Customer Support: To communicate with you about your account, services, and updates.
To communicate with you about your account, services, and updates.
• Personalization: To customise your experience with our platform.
To customise your experience with our platform.
• Analytics and Research: To understand usage patterns and improve our services.
To understand usage patterns and improve our services.
• Legal Compliance: To comply with applicable laws and regulations.
To comply with applicable laws and regulations.
We may share your personal data under the following circumstances:
• Service Providers: With trusted third-party providers who assist us in operating our business under strict confidentiality agreements.
With trusted third-party providers who assist us in operating our business under strict confidentiality agreements.
• Business Transactions: In the event of mergers, acquisitions, or other business transactions, your data may be transferred as part of the process.
In the event of mergers, acquisitions, or other business transactions, your data may be transferred as part of the process.
• Legal Requirements: When required by law or to protect our rights, property, or safety.
When required by law or to protect our rights, property, or safety.

If your personal data is transferred outside of your home country or the European Economic Area (EEA), we will implement appropriate safeguards to ensure your data is protected in accordance with applicable laws.
We employ robust security measures, including encryption and secure servers, to protect your personal data from unauthorized access, loss, or misuse.

We retain your personal data only for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes outlined in this policy or as required by law. Once your data is no longer needed, it will be securely deleted or anonymized.
You have the following rights regarding your personal data:
• Access: To request access to the personal data we hold about you.
To request access to the personal data we hold about you.
• Correction: To correct any inaccuracies or incomplete data.
To correct any inaccuracies or incomplete data.
• Erasure: To request the deletion of your data.
To request the deletion of your data.
• RestrictionTo restrict the processing of your data under certain conditions.
To restrict the processing of your data under certain conditions.
• PortabilityTo request the transfer of your data to another service provider.
To request the transfer of your data to another service provider.
• Objection: To object to certain types of processing, including direct marketing.
To object to certain types of processing, including direct marketing.
• Withdrawal of Consent: To withdraw your consent at any time without affecting the lawfulness of prior processing.
To withdraw your consent at any time without affecting the lawfulness of prior processing.
To exercise these rights, please contact us using the details provided below.

Our website uses cookies and similar tracking technologies to improve your experience. You can manage your cookie preferences through your browser settings. Disabling cookies may impact the functionality of our services.
Our platform may include links to external websites. We are not responsible for their privacy practices, and we encourage you to review their privacy policies before providing any personal data.
12. Changes to This Data Protection Policy
12. Changes to This Data Protection Policy
We may update this Data Protection Policy to reflect changes in our practices or legal obligations. Any significant changes will be communicated through our website.
If you have any questions or concerns about this Data Protection Policy or wish to exercise your rights, please contact us at:

This section applies to residents of California, subject to the California Consumer Privacy Act of 2018 (CCPA) and the California Privacy Rights Act of 2020 (CPRA). These laws provide specific rights regarding your personal information. California residents can request information about personal data disclosed to third parties for direct marketing purposes under the California Civil Code Section 1798.83. To make such requests, please contact us using the details provided below.

Effective January 1, 2020, the CCPA grants California residents specific rights concerning their personal data. This section outlines our compliance with the CCPA and related laws, defining terms consistent with the CCPA.
Over the past 12 months, we have collected the following categories of personal information:
• IdentifiersNames, addresses, email addresses, and other unique identifiers.
Names, addresses, email addresses, and other unique identifiers.
• Personal Information (California Customer Records): Contact information, financial details, and other personal data.
Contact information, financial details, and other personal data.
• Protected Classification Characteristics: Age, race, gender, disability, and other classifications.
Age, race, gender, disability, and other classifications.
• Commercial Information: Purchase history and consumer preferences.
• Internet Activity: Browsing and search history.
• Geolocation Data: Physical location or movements.
• Sensory Data: Audio, visual, and similar information.
For a complete list and additional details, please contact us or refer to our Privacy Policy.
Comprehensive Overview of California Privacy Regulations
Comprehensive Overview of California Privacy Regulations

This section is for California residents and is regulated by the California Consumer Privacy Act of 2018 (CCPA) and the California Privacy Rights Act of 2020 (CPRA). These laws grant specific rights regarding your personal data. Under California Civil Code Section 1798.83, California residents can request information about personal data shared with third parties for direct marketing. For such requests, please reach out using the contact details provided below.

Effective January 1, 2020, the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) provides California residents with specific rights concerning their personal data. This section outlines our commitment to complying with the CCPA and related regulations, ensuring that our practices align with the law’s requirements and definitions.
Detailed Overview of Personal Data Categories We Collect
Detailed Overview of Personal Data Categories We Collect
In the past 12 months, we have collected a range of unique identifiers, including:
• Names:Full names used in registration, transactions, or interactions.
Full names used in registration, transactions, or interactions.
• Addresses: Both postal and email addresses used for communication and service delivery.
Both postal and email addresses used for communication and service delivery.
• Email Addresses: For account creation, correspondence, and notifications.
For account creation, correspondence, and notifications.
• Other Unique Identifiers: Such as user IDs, account numbers, or similar identifiers that uniquely distinguish you from other users.
Such as user IDs, account numbers, or similar identifiers that uniquely distinguish you from other users.
We gather various types of personal information as defined by California law, which includes
• Contact Details: : Information such as phone numbers, email addresses, and physical addresses used for customer service and communication.
: Information such as phone numbers, email addresses, and physical addresses used for customer service and communication.
• Financial Information: Data related to transactions including credit card numbers, bank account details, and billing information.
Data related to transactions including credit card numbers, bank account details, and billing information.
• Additional Personal Data: Other information pertinent to customer records that may include, but is not limited to, purchase histories and payment preferences.
Other information pertinent to customer records that may include, but is not limited to, purchase histories and payment preferences.
To ensure compliance with anti-discrimination laws and for certain operational purposes, we collect data related to:
• Age: To verify eligibility and tailor services.
To verify eligibility and tailor services.
• Race:For diversity reporting and compliance with equal opportunity laws.
For diversity reporting and compliance with equal opportunity laws.
• Gender: To customise user experiences and communications.
To customise user experiences and communications.
• Disability Status: To provide necessary accommodations and support.
To provide necessary accommodations and support.
• Other Protected Characteristics: As required by California or federal law, such as marital status or veteran status.
As required by California or federal law, such as marital status or veteran status.
We track various aspects of consumer behaviour and transactions, including:
• Records of Personal Property: : Information about items owned or sought by the user.
: Information about items owned or sought by the user.
• Products and Services: Details about the products or services purchased, obtained, or considered, including frequency and types of purchases.
Details about the products or services purchased, obtained, or considered, including frequency and types of purchases.
• Purchasing Habits and Preferences: Data that helps us understand consumer preferences and tailor offerings accordingly.
Data that helps us understand consumer preferences and tailor offerings accordingly.
To enhance user experience and improve our services, we collect data on:
• Browsing History: : Information on websites visited and pages viewed.
: Information on websites visited and pages viewed.
• Search History: Data on search terms and queries made on our platforms.
Data on search terms and queries made on our platforms.
• Interactions: Details about how users interact with our website, applications, and advertisements, including clicks, navigation patterns, and engagement metrics.
Details about how users interact with our website, applications, and advertisements, including clicks, navigation patterns, and engagement metrics.
To provide location-based services and improve user experience, we collect:

This detailed collection of personal data enables us to provide, improve, and tailor our services to better meet your needs and preferences. For more information on how we handle and protect your personal data, please refer to our full Privacy Policy or contact us directly.
We utilize the personal information we collect to effectively provide, manage, and improve our services. This includes:

Ensuring adherence to legal and regulatory obligations, such as record-keeping requirements and compliance with laws.

Your personal information will be retained for as long as you maintain an active account with us. If your account becomes inactive or is terminated, we will keep your personal data only for the duration necessary to meet our legal, regulatory, and operational obligations. This retention period may include:

• Legal and Regulatory Requirements: Retaining data to comply with applicable laws, such as financial regulations or data protection laws. This may involve maintaining records for specific periods as required by law.
Retaining data to comply with applicable laws, such as financial regulations or data protection laws. This may involve maintaining records for specific periods as required by law.
• Operational Needs: Keeping information necessary for ongoing business operations, such as resolving disputes or processing returns.
Keeping information necessary for ongoing business operations, such as resolving disputes or processing returns.
Once the retention period has expired, we will take steps to securely delete or anonymize your personal information. This means that:
• Deletion: Data will be permanently removed from our systems and backups, ensuring it is no longer accessible or recoverable.
Data will be permanently removed from our systems and backups, ensuring it is no longer accessible or recoverable.
• Anonymization:In some cases, we may convert personal data into a form that no longer identifies you, allowing us to use it for statistical or analytical purposes without compromising your privacy.
In some cases, we may convert personal data into a form that no longer identifies you, allowing us to use it for statistical or analytical purposes without compromising your privacy.

We implement robust security measures to protect your personal information throughout its retention period. This includes physical, technical, and administrative safeguards to prevent unauthorized access, use, or disclosure.

We periodically review our data retention practices to ensure they align with our operational needs and legal obligations. Any changes to our retention policies will be reflected in updates to this Privacy Policy. We encourage you to review this policy regularly to stay informed about how your personal data is managed. The Fair Information Practice Principles (FIPPs) form the core of privacy law in the United States and significantly influence global data protection laws. To align with Fair Information Practices, we commit to the following actions in the event of a data breach:
• Notification: We will inform affected users via email within seven (7) business days.
We will inform affected users via email within seven (7) business days.

• Individual Redress: We adhere to the principle that individuals have the right to pursue legally enforceable actions against data collectors and processors who do not comply with the law. This principle ensures that individuals can seek recourse through courts or government agencies if data processors fail to meet legal standards.

We adhere to the principle that individuals have the right to pursue legally enforceable actions against data collectors and processors who do not comply with the law. This principle ensures that individuals can seek recourse through courts or government agencies if data processors fail to meet legal standards.
The CAN-SPAM Act regulates commercial emails, outlining requirements for messages and granting recipients the right to opt out of future communications. To comply with CAN-SPAM:
• Unsubscribing: If you wish to unsubscribe from future emails, please email us at privacy@novacrm.ca, and we will promptly remove you from all correspondence.

, and we will promptly remove you from all correspondence.

Our services are intended for individuals aged 18 and older. We do not knowingly collect personal information from anyone under 18 years of age. If we discover that we have inadvertently collected such information, we will delete it as soon as possible. If you suspect we have information from a child under 18, please contact us at
When accessing data from Google APIs, we adhere to Google’s API Services User Data Policy, including the Limited Use requirements. Specifically:

• Gmail Data: We will use access to read and write Gmail message bodies, metadata, and settings solely to provide our email client services. We will not transfer this data to third parties except as necessary to enhance features, comply with laws, or during a merger or acquisition.
